tool_description: Validates fire suppression system designs against applicable building codes, NFPA standards, and local regulations to ensure regulatory compliance.

building_code.description: Applicable building code (IBC, NFPA, local code)

system_type.description: Type of suppression system being designed

sprinkler_coverage.description: Percentage of building area covered by sprinklers

error_messages: Unknown jurisdiction: The specified jurisdiction is not recognized in the database.
Invalid building code: Must specify IBC, NFPA 101, NFPA 1, or a recognized local code.
Unsupported system type: System type must be from approved suppression system categories.
Invalid occupancy classification: Must match NFPA occupancy classification standards.
Invalid coverage percentage: Must be between 0 and 100 percent.
usage: Specify the jurisdiction, applicable building code, system type, and occupancy classification. Optionally provide sprinkler coverage percentage. The tool will check compliance requirements and identify any violations or gaps.

compliance_status.description: Overall compliance status (Compliant, Non-Compliant, Requires Review)

applicable_standards.description: List of applicable codes and standards

violations_found.description: List of compliance violations or deficiencies
